original_title: Nationwide Power Restored After Five Hour Outage, CEB Launches Investigation
original_body_lines: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has announced that power has been fully restored throughout the island, just five and a half hours after a nationwide outage.
The outage, which started around 5:10 PM yesterday, was caused by a fault in the transmission system between Kothmale and Biyagama.
The CEB has launched a special investigation to determine the cause of the fault.
The outage caused significant disruptions for many people across the country.
The spokesperson of the CEB, Engineer Noel Priyantha said that a special investigation has commenced in this regard
The State and Public service trade unions collective plans to go on sick leave tomorrow.
